23cc98d8-a460-41ad-b7be-63407aea6e97.description: RDs and RDNs are food and nutrition experts who have met the Commission on Dietetic Registration’s (CDR) criteria to become credentialed through the completion of academic, supervised practice, and examination requirements. RD and RDNs work in a wide variety of settings, including health care, business and industry, community/public health, education, research, government agencies and private practice.
23cc98d8-a460-41ad-b7be-63407aea6e97.name: Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

alignments.name: ACEND Standards for Nutrition and Dietetics
alignments.description: The Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND®) 2017 Accreditation Standards for Nutrition and Dietetics Coordinated Programs (CP), Didactic Programs (DPD), and Internship Programs (DI).

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a minimum of a bachelor’s degree granted by a US  accredited institution (or foreign equivalent).

Completion of Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND) accredited didactic coursework in dietetics through a Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD), Coordinated Program (CP), or Future Education Model Graduate Programs (FG).

Completion of at least 1,000 hours of supervised practice through an Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND) accredited Dietetic Internship (DI), Coordinated Program (CP), or Future Education Model Graduate Programs (FG).

Submission by Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND) accredited supervised practice program director to the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) for registration examination for dietitians eligibility.
Successfully pass the registration exam which is multiple-choice and computer-adaptive.

Credentialed practitioners are required to maintain certification through continuous learning in order to ensure professional knowledge and competence. RDs and RDNs need to complete and log 75 credits per 5 year cycle (1 credit must be in ethics).

b8ebb36a-acff-4a2e-9761-3f23b1dc161b.description: DTRs and NDTRs have met the Commission on Dietetic Registration’s (CDR) criteria to become credentialed through the completion of Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND) accredited academic, supervised practice, and examination requirements. DTRs and NDTRs are an integral part of healthcare and foodservice management teams that work in a variety of work settings that navigate between food service and clinical nutrition care.
b8ebb36a-acff-4a2e-9761-3f23b1dc161b.name: Dietetic Technician, Registered (DTR) or Nutrition and Dietetics Technician Registered (NDTR)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

alignments.name: ACEND Standards for Nutrition and Dietetics
alignments.description: The Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND®) 2017 Accreditation Standards for Nutrition and Dietetics Didactic Programs (DPD) and Dietetic Technician (DT) programs.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a minimum of an associate degree (if followed by an ACEND accredited Dietetic Technician Program) or bachelor's degree (if followed by an ACEND accredited Didactic Program in Dietetics) granted by a US accredited institution (or foreign equivalent).
If an individual has a bachelor's degree, they may complete an ACEND accredited Didactic Program in Dietetics to become eligible for the registration exam.
Individuals who have a minimum of an associate degree must complete an ACEND accredited Dietetic Technician Program which includes a minimum of 450 supervised practice hours.

Submission by ACEND accredited supervised practice or didactic program director to the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) for registration examination for dietetic technicians eligibility. CDR performs primary source evaluation of documentation to confirm completion of degree, nutrition coursework, and supervised practice requirements.
Successfully pass the registration exam which is multiple-choice, and computer-adaptive.

Credentialed practitioners are required to maintain certification through continuous learning  to ensure professional knowledge and competence. DTRs and NDTRs need to complete and log 50 credits per 5-year cycle (1 credit must be in ethics).

b3322e42-1cad-43a0-99e5-e35d35a3e079.description: CSSDs provide individual/group/team nutrition counseling and education to enhance the performance of competitive and recreational athletes. Primary responsibilities include counseling individuals or groups on daily nutrition performance and health; translating the latest scientific evidence into practical sports nutrition recommendations; tracking and documenting outcomes of nutrition services, serving as a food and nutrition resource for coaches, sports performance, support staff and families.
b3322e42-1cad-43a0-99e5-e35d35a3e079.name: Board Certified Specialist in Sports Dietetics (CSSD)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of current RD status with CDR for a minimum of 2 years from the original examination date.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of practice experience as an RD in sports dietetics within the past five years.
Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of work as an RD in sports dietetics.
Successfully pass a 150-item computer-based, multiple-choice exam.

e308f517-3721-4411-a086-2de5a86354cf.description: CSOs are RDs working directly with individuals at risk for, or diagnosed with, any type of malignancy or pre-malignant condition, in a variety of settings (e.g. hospitals, clinics, cancer centers, hospices, public health) OR indirectly through roles in management, education, industry, and research practice linked specifically to oncology nutrition.
e308f517-3721-4411-a086-2de5a86354cf.name: Board Certified Specialist in Oncology Nutrition (CSO)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of current RD status with CDR for a minimum of 2 years from the original examination date.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of practice experience as an RD in oncology nutrition within the past five years.
Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of work as an RD in oncology nutrition.
Successfully pass a 150-item computer-based, multiple-choice exam.

403e6310-c619-437b-8ed7-fb94d89d57b6.description: CSPs are experienced RDs who apply evidence-based nutrition knowledge in providing medical nutrition therapy for pediatric patients. They work directly with healthy and/or ill children (newborn through 21 years of age) and with children with special health care needs in a variety of settings OR indirectly through management, care coordination, education, quality improvement, or research practice linked specifically to pediatric nutrition.
403e6310-c619-437b-8ed7-fb94d89d57b6.name: Board Certified Specialist in Pediatric Nutrition (CSP)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of current RD status with CDR for a minimum of 2 years from the original examination date.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of practice experience as an RD in pediatric nutrition within the past five years.
Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of work as an RD in pediatric nutrition.
Successfully pass a 150-item computer-based, multiple-choice exam.

e825d346-0bed-45fe-82e5-5873a2a473dc.description: The CSR works directly with adult and/or pediatric patients with acute kidney injury, chronic kidney disease (CKD) stages 1-5, or receiving renal replacement therapies (dialysis/transplant) in a variety of settings OR works indirectly in management, education, or research practice linked specifically to renal nutrition. The specialist in renal/nephrology nutrition is responsible for nutrition assessment, diagnosis, intervention, monitoring, and evaluation.
e825d346-0bed-45fe-82e5-5873a2a473dc.name: Board Certified Specialist in Renal Nutrition (CSR)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of current RD status with CDR for a minimum of 2 years from the original examination date.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of practice experience as an RD in renal/nephrology nutrition within the past five years.
Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of work as an RD in renal/nephrology nutrition.
Successfully pass a 150-item computer-based, multiple-choice exam.

83568139-69c9-467f-a70d-c434d692aac0.description: CSGs are RDs or RDNs directly providing nutrition care to promote quality of life and optimal health for older adults across the continuum of care, including: acute care, post-acute care, primary care, long-term care, assisted living, home care, palliative care, community-based nutrition, food service, correctional facilities, and government programs OR indirectly working with gerontological nutrition through roles in management, industry, education, and research.
83568139-69c9-467f-a70d-c434d692aac0.name: Board Certified Specialist in Gerontological Nutrition (CSG)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of current RD status with CDR for a minimum of 2 years from the original examination date.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of practice experience as an RD in gerontological nutrition within the past five years.
Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of work as an RD in gerontological nutrition.
Successfully pass a 150-item computer-based, multiple-choice exam.

23386d48-a86f-4a9d-b69a-6d5b0d4e030b.description: A CSOWM is a health professional who possesses comprehensive knowledge of and expertise in obesity and weight management. A CSOWM professional educates, supports, and empowers patients/clients to understand and manage their weight and risks associated with being overweight or obese through nutritional, physical, psychological, behavioral, medical and/or surgical interventions.
23386d48-a86f-4a9d-b69a-6d5b0d4e030b.name: Board Certified Specialist in Obesity and Weight Management (CSOWM)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of a current, valid certification as an APRN (NPs or CNSs from AANPCB, ANCC, NCC, or PCNB), Exercise Physiologist (ACSM-CEP, ACSM-RCEP, ACSM-EP), Licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Licensed Pharmacist, Licensed Physical Therapist, PA-C (NCCPA), or Registered Dietitians (CDR) for a minimum of two years by the time of application.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of specialty practice experience in obesity and weight management while holding one of the aforementioned credentials within the past five years.
Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of recent work in obesity and weight management.
Successfully pass a 150-item computer-based, multiple-choice exam.

3da8874c-98c3-49e7-8184-50e404f5cb82.description: CSPCCs are experienced RDs who apply evidence-based nutrition knowledge in providing medical nutrition therapy for critically ill infants, children, and adolescents. Additional roles could include care coordination, education, quality improvement, or research linked specifically to pediatric critical care nutrition.
3da8874c-98c3-49e7-8184-50e404f5cb82.name: Board Certified Specialist in Pediatric Critical Care Nutrition (CSPCC)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of current RD status with CDR for a minimum of 2 years from the original examination date.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of practice experience as an RD in pediatric critical care nutrition within the past five years.
Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of work as an RD in pediatric critical care nutrition.
Successfully pass a 150-item computer-based, multiple-choice exam.

ccf0ed60-b087-47c1-9b22-56a09a288309.description: RD-APs or RDN-APs are experienced RDs who have the knowledge and skill required to autonomously apply the nutrition care process, using an evidenced-based approach, at an optimal level of accuracy and efficiency. These individuals function above a specialist level with an expanded scope of practice and strategically select the most appropriate nutrition interventions by effectively planning, evaluating, and communicating targeted outcomes in clinical nutrition.
ccf0ed60-b087-47c1-9b22-56a09a288309.name: Advanced Practitioner in Clinical Nutrition (RD-AP or RDN-AP)

issuer.summary: issued by Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

badge_template_activities.title: Maintenance of current RD status with CDR for a minimum of 4 years from the original examination date.
Documentation of 2,000 hours of practice experience as an RD in clinical nutrition within the past five years.

Completion of one professional experience: 1) graduate degree, 2) evidence of presenting research to a professional audience within the past five years, 3) evidence of publishing or editing/reviewing a peer-reviewed clinical nutrition article, book, or book chapter within the past five years, 4) specialist certification in a clinical nutrition-related topic requiring the RD or RDN as a prerequisite qualification. Candidates must hold the specialist certification at the time of the examination.

Submission of an eligibility application requiring third-party verification of 2,000 hours of work as an RD in clinical nutrition along with evidence of a graduate degree, presentation, publication/review, or a specialist credential.
Successfully pass a computer-based, multiple-choice and case management exam.
